Steps.Message:
Sent by Lee at 11:08 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 564 customers that were affected in the CB25 9, CB5 9, CB25 0 area by diverting the power around a underground cable fault.

We're pleased that we have been able to restore power sooner than we estimated.

If your power isn't back on, we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hello, Lee from the messaging team here. Thanks for your patience today, our field staff and control room engineers are working to get your power back on as quickly as they can.

Our records show that some properties affected by today's power cut may have had other unexpected interruptions recently. If you have, we're sorry for further disruption. All power cuts are fully investigated by our engineers but can sometimes happen multiple times before we can safely find the issue and fix it.

We know that not everyone affected by today's power cut will have had other power cuts recently, but we want you to know that if you have, our customer services team will try to update as many customers as possible about our investigations.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Lee at 10:44 -We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, we appreciate how disruptive this must be for you, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Lee at 10:06 - Hi - thanks for bearing with us, I know a power cut can be very disruptive. We've had an update from our staff that there are now 54 properties still affected by the underground cable fault, as they have managed to safely divert some power, getting the lights back on for 510 of our customers. We'll keep sending text updates to everyone until all the power to your area is on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lee at 10:03 - We're sorry your power has gone off again today. Our engineers investigated the fault earlier but it seems there may be a bigger underlying issue which is causing our substation equipment to operate repeatedly.

Our engineers are still on site investigating and using an average time frame, we are aiming to have all power back on between 1130 -1230 We'll keep you updated with all of our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lee at 09:26 - Our engineers have restored power to all 441properties in the CB25 9, CB5 9, CB25 0 area, and we're pleased that this is sooner than we estimated. They have diverted power around an underground cable fault.

We know some properties in the area may have faced other recent interruptions, and we're sorry for the extra disruption. Every outage is fully investigated by our engineers, though power may be lost several times before we can safely find and fix the issue. Our customer services team will keep as many customers updated as possible during these investigations. 

We're sorry for the unplanned disruption. If you need to talk to us, or let us know that your power isn't restored, call us on 08003163105.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lee at 09:11 - Thanks for your patience this morning.

Our staff are checking our equipment throughout the area to pinpoint the issue on our underground cabling network. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by Theo at 10:26
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Glebelands Avenue area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Sent by Theo at 10:14.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 09:24 - Our staff are on the way to the Glebelands Avenue area, and our estimated time frame to have power back on is currently between 13:00 and 14:00. However, this could change once our staff have assessed the local network.

We believe the power cuts you have been experiencing are caused by a fault with one of the cables. Developing faults can start very small, and so can be hard to detect but each power cut usually makes it easier to see, which means our specialist staff can detect it, and work on the repair to prevent further outages.

I'll let you know once our teams arrive.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: A fault has occurred on a piece of our electrical equipment which controls the power to your home.

Logs.Comment:
We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by Theo at 10:26

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the BN5, BN44 and RH13 area to investigate the power cut affecting 26 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Talie at 10:47.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Talie at 10:26 - Hi - thanks for bearing with us, I know a power cut can be very disruptive. We've had an update from our staff that there are now 26 properties still affected by the overhead cable fault, as they have managed to safely divert some power, getting the lights back on for 26 of our customers. We'll keep sending text updates to everyone until all the power to your area is on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Talie at 09:44 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is an overhead cable fault that initially interrupted power to 536 properties. However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 52 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment. We're currently estimating power will be on between 12:30-13:30, but this may change depending on what our staff find. Power back on? To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.

Midfield Avenue.

equipment in your area. This has identified 4 cables and 3 poles that need upgrading. Doing this
will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future.

the power is off for the shortest possible time, our contractors Avidety may carry out preparation
works prior to the power cut.

This work is taking place near Station Road.

We are removing overhead electricity cables and replacing them with new underground electricity
cables. We will also be upgrading a piece of equipment known as a transformer. Doing this will
reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate your area has
been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months.
To carry out the work safely we need to turn your power off. To ensure the power is off for the
shortest possible time, our contractors may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified cables and 6 poles that need replacing and upgrading. We will also be replacing stay wires and transferring service cables to the new poles. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to upgrade the equipment. To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, our contractors may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut. This work is taking place in Cooks Drove. A road closure will be in place to allow the work to be carried out safely. Access to your property will always be provided.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 11:07 - Our engineers have restored power to all 214 properties in the TN27 9 area, and we're pleased that this is sooner than we estimated. They have diverted power around the overhead cable fault.

We know some properties in the area may have faced other recent interruptions, and we're sorry for the extra disruption. Every outage is fully investigated by our engineers, though power may be lost several times before we can safely find and fix the issue. Our customer services team will keep as many customers updated as possible during these investigations. 

We're sorry for the unplanned disruption. If you need to talk to us, or let us know that your power isn't restored, call us on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the TN27 9 area to investigate the power cut affecting 214 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Talie at 10:52.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 10:38 - Our engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is an overhead cable fault affecting 214 properties.

Specialist engineers from our control room are also working to divert power remotely, so it's possible your power could come back on at any point. We can't always restore everyone this way. That's why we're also sending staff to the area to check our equipment.

Every fault is different, so our time frames have to be estimated but currently we hope to have power back on between 13:30 and 14:30. We must stress that it may become necessary for this to change, depending on what our engineers find.

We'll keep you updated with our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.

Sent by Will at 00:53 - We can now confirm that all power in the James Street area should now be back on. 

We know there was another power cut recently, but following tests made by our engineers they have advised the issues are unrelated, so we don't currently expect this to affect your power again.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the recent outages. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We are connecting a new property to the underground electricity network. This work is at the request of a third party as we have a duty to provide electricity when requested. Once completed this will improve the reliability of our electricity network, ensuring the area can handle the capacity of electricity requested in the area as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. Please turn over for useful information. This work is taking place on Maidstone Road. Please note there will be multi way traffic lights on Maidstone Road and the entrance of the Holiday Inn Hotel before and during the planned power cut.

Steps.Message: Good morning, this is a message from Harry at UK Power Networks regarding the planned power cut that is currently in progress today the 4th December 2025 in the NR15 postcode area. Our engineers have advised that unfortunately there is going to be a delay in restoring your power. This is due to the earlier engineering difficulties experienced on site which have delayed the progression of the works. We now estimate to restore your power between approximately 12:30 and 13:30. Please note that this is an estimated time frame and that your power may come on sooner. Our reference number for this work is INCD-15850-I. We would like to apologise for any inconvenience this may cause you. If you have any questions or you have moved from the NR15 postcode area, then please give us a call on 105.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near Church Road.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 11:08 - We can now confirm that all power in the area should be back on. Our engineers had to unexpectedly turn off the power to safely repair an underground network fault in the Bristol Gardens area.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Theo at 10:17 - We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, we appreciate how disruptive this must be for you, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript:
This work is taking place near High Street.

To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of trees
near our overhead cables. This has identified trees that have grown close, which could damage
the cables and affect your electricity supply.
Our engineers need to temporarily switch off your power so we can safely cut the trees away from
8 sections of cables. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the
future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last
6 months.

Steps.Message: Good morning, this is a message from Alicia at UK Power Networks regarding the planned power cut that is currently in progress today the 4th of December 2025 in the CM19 postcode area. Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 09:44 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Decasta at 10:03 - We can now confirm that all power in the NW1 4 area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Sent by Decasta at 09:44 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript:
This work is taking place near Rocklands
Road. 
To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of trees
near our overhead cables. This has identified trees that have grown close to 2 spans of cables,
which could damage the cables and affect your electricity supply.
Our contractors need to temporarily switch off your power so we can safely cut the trees away
from the cables. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future
as we appreciate that some customers may have experienced multiple unplanned power cuts in
the last 6 months.

Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near the M20.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 01:58 - We can now confirm that all power in the St Anthony's Avenue area should now be back on.

We know there have been previous power cuts this year, but following network tests made by our engineers today we do not believe they are related. We'll continue to monitor the situation closely however.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for these outages. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on. If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 01:01 - Thanks for bearing with us tonight.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Engineers have arrived on site to investigate what we believe to be an issue at the local substation in the St Anthony's Avenue area. Using an average timescale for this type of issue, we're looking to have you back on between 03:30 and 04:30, however we must stress that this time may change, depending on what our staff find. We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress, but for more information about this type of fault; here's a short YouTube video https://bit.ly/2y8Dtfz. Sent by Will at 00:50.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 02:12 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Queen Street area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected underground cable fault, which our engineers have been able to divert power around by isolating the faulty section from the main network.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Will at 01:10 - Our engineers have advised us that in order to continue their works on the underground network fault safely, they have had to turn off power to further properties in the area. Our estimated time hasn't changed, however its possible this may need to be adjusted depending on how their work progresses. If you'd like more information about why we sometimes have to switch power off to work; here's a short video https://bit.ly/3cYez0V. We'll keep you updated with progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 00:59 - Thanks for bearing with us over tonight. Our team of cable jointers believe they have now identified the suspected section of faulted underground cabling using their specialist equipment.

Our digging team are now starting excavations, these can take time due to the surface material and how much space will be needed for our engineers to assess the fault but at this stage we're still estimating to have the power back on between 02:30 and 03:30.

We're sorry to change our time frame, but we'll continue to keep you updated and our team are always here if you have any questions.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future as we appreciate you may have been impacted by an unplanned fault in the last 6 months. This work is taking place near Horseman Side.

Steps.Message: Good morning, this is a message from Alicia at UK Power Networks regarding the planned power cut which is currently in progress today the 4th of December 2025 in the CB10 postcode area. Our engineers have advised us that the 15 affected properties will be restored early at approximately 09:50 as the works have progressed quicker than expected due to having good access to our equipment. We can confirm that once power has been restored to the area that the works to examine a transformer near New House Lane will be completed which will improve the reliability of the network and reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. Our reference number for this work is INCD-16202-I. I hope that the power coming on earlier is of benefit to you. We always aim to provide a 10/10 service, if you feel we have not delivered you a 10/10 service then please call us on 105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: An underground electricity cable faulted on our high voltage network, causing an area wide power cut.
PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by 11kV UG Fault affecting the electricity supply in your area. Our engineers are dealing with this and we estimate that most supplies will be restored by 02-DEC-2025 23:00.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.
